fields.name: Channel Sensitivity
fields.description: Defines the nominal value (maximum 20 characters, data type NM) that corresponds to one unit in the waveform data, that is, the effective resolution of the least significant bit of the ADC, and the polarity of the channel.  The sensitivity incorporates both the amplifier gain and the actual ADC resolution.  It does not, however, relate to the vertical scaling of a waveform display (it is, for example, a measure of voltage, not voltage per unit distance).  For channels recording potential differences between two electrodes using a differential amplifier, a positive sensitivity indicates that a number in the waveform data which is greater than the channel baseline represents a potential at the first electrode which is more positive than that at the second electrode.  A negative sensitivity indicates that a number in the waveform data which is greater than the channel baseline corresponds to a potential at the first electrode which is more negative than that at the second electrode

fields.name: Unit Of Measure Identifier
fields.description: A units designation (for example, uv, mv, v, pal, or mm(hg).  Codes from the ISO+ extension of the standard SI single case unit abbreviations are presented as Figure 7-6, 7-7, and 7-8 in Section NNNN, the ANSI+ U.S. customary unit abbreviations, a superset of the ANSI standard which appears in Figure 7-9

fields.name: Unit Of Measure Description
fields.description: The full text name of the unit of measure identifier (for example, microvolt, millivolt, volt, pascal or millimeters of mercury) from a designated system of units

fields.name: Unit Of Measure Coding System
fields.description: The designated system of units. Refer to User-defined table 0396 – Coding System for suggested values

fields.name: Alternate Unit Of Measure Identifier
fields.description: An alternate units designation (for example, uv, mv, v, pal, or mm(hg) . Codes from the ISO+ extension of the standard SI single case unit abbreviations are presented as Figure 7-6, 7-7, and 7-8 in Section 7.4.2.6.2, the ANSI+ U.S. customary unit abbreviations, a superset of the ANSI standard which appears in Figure 7-9

fields.name: Alternate Unit Of Measure Description
fields.description: The full text name of the alternate unit of measure identifier (for example, microvolt, millivolt, volt, pascal or millimeters of mercury) from a designated system of units

fields.name: Alternate Unit Of Measure Coding System
fields.description: The alternate designated system of units.  Refer to User-defined table 0396 – Coding System for suggested values
